MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8* buffer, int32 length) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to the start of the memory block.
Length in bytes of the memory block.

Docs.exception: is and is greater than zero.
The current platform is not little-endian.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Align(unsigned int8 alignment) cil managed

Docs.summary: Repositions the reader forward by the number of bytes required to satisfy the given alignment.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte* CurrentPointer { System::Byte* get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a pointer to the byte at the current position of the reader.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(unsigned int8 value) cil managed
Public Function IndexOf (value As Byte) As Integer

Docs.summary: Searches for a specified byte in the blob following the current position.
Docs.returns: The index relative to the current position, or -1 if the byte is not found in the blob following the current position.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Doesn't change the current position.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Length As Integer
public: property int Length { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total length of the underlying memory block.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Offset As Integer
public: property int Offset { int get(); };
public: property int Offset { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Offset : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the offset from the start of the blob to the current position.
Docs.exception: The offset is set outside the bounds of the underlying reader.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Reflection.Metadata.BlobHandle ReadBlobHandle() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads a Blob heap handle encoded as a compressed integer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Blobs that contain references to other blobs are used in Portable PDB format, for example <xref:System.Reflection.Metadata.Document.Name>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadCompressedInteger() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads an unsigned compressed integer value. See Metadata Specification section II.23.2: Blobs and signatures.
Docs.returns: The value of the compressed integer that was read.
Docs.exception: The data at the current position was not a valid compressed integer.

Docs.summary: Reads a signed compressed integer value. See Metadata Specification section II.23.2: Blobs and signatures.
Docs.returns: The value of the compressed integer that was read.
Docs.exception: The data at the current position was not a valid compressed integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object ReadConstant(valuetype System.Reflection.Metadata.ConstantTypeCode typeCode) cil managed
Public Function ReadConstant (typeCode As ConstantTypeCode) As Object

Docs.summary: Reads a constant value (see ECMA-335 Partition II section 22.9) from the current position.
Docs.returns: A boxed constant value. To avoid allocating the object use Read* methods directly.
Docs.remarks: Constants of type are encoded as UTF16 strings, use to read them.
Docs.exception: Error while reading from the blob.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.DateTime ReadDateTime() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Decimal ReadDecimal() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads a number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Decimal number is encoded in 13 bytes as follows:
- byte 0: highest bit indicates sign (1 for negative, 0 for non-negative); the remaining 7 bits encode scale. - bytes 1..12: 96-bit unsigned integer in little endian encoding.

Docs.exception: The data at the current position was not a valid number.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ReadSerializedString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads a string encoded as a compressed integer containing its length followed by its contents in UTF8. Null strings are encoded as a single 0xFF byte.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Defined as a 'SerString' in the ECMA CLI specification.
